wikipedia_page.main: David Ramsey Foster, DSO, DSC and bar (24 May 1920 – 4 June 2010) was a decorated pilot in the British Royal Navy during World War II and a business executive.

response: Johns has been married four times. Her first husband was Anthony Forwood (m. 1942–48), with whom she had her only child, actor Gareth Forwood, in 1945.Lentz, Harris M. "Gareth Forwood" Obituaries in the Performing Arts, 2007: Film, Television, Radio, Theatre, Dance, Music, Cartoons and Pop Culture, McFarland, 2008, , p. 124 During these years, she was the daughter-in-law of actor Dirk Bogarde, Forwood's father. From 1952 to 1956, she was married to David Foster, a Royal Navy officer and later president of Colgate-Palmolive."Obituary" The Telegraph, 18 July 2010 She married Cecil Henderson, a businessman, in 1960."1960 Press Photo British actress Glynis Johns and husband Cecil Henderson" picclick.co.uk, retrieved 7 April 2019 She married Elliott Arnold, a writer, in 1964."British Actress Married" Tucson Daily Citizen (archives), October 2, 1964Berkvist, Robert. "Miss Johns Hits a High Note" The New York Times, March 11, 1973"Glynis Johns Companions" tcm.com, retrieved 7 April 2019"Glynis Johns Is Engaged" The New York Times, June 25, 1964
David Foster (born 1949) is a Canadian musician and record producer, pianist.
David Foster may also refer to:
*David Foster (rugby league), rugby league footballer of the 1990s and 2000s
*David Foster (writer), American television writer (House), producer and medical doctor
*David Foster (film producer) (1929–2019), American film producer (The Mask of Zorro, The Thing)
*David Foster Wallace (1962–2008), American novelist, essayist, and short-story writer
